definition: to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)

sentences.english: They fear (and not that unreasonably) that this would give the debtor states less incentive to reform.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有缘由地害怕这会致使借贷国家不思改革。

sentences.english: The reason for this, of course, was the fierce battle that was raging in Gaza.
sentences.chinese: 个中缘由，自是肆虐加沙地带的激战。

sentences.english: I understand some reasons for the confusion and controversy.

sentences.english: And we know exactly why she chose that boot.
sentences.chinese: 并且我们要清楚她选择这款靴子的真正缘由。

sentences.english: Part one clarifies the reason why Chinese book education for senior middle school student must be carried out .

sentences.english: Only now does the man on the line think to ask why I am calling.

sentences.english: A sweet and pretty bamboo shoots girl , the bamboo is exactly knocked for itself.

sentences.english: Feelings of depression or gloominess result from a lack of self confidence.
sentences.chinese: 感到消沉或沮丧的缘由是缺乏自信。

sentences.english: Jeter with everyone to participate in ceremony, and inform everyone rebuffed reason.
sentences.chinese: 吉特不随人人去参与典礼，而且回绝通知人人缘由。

sentences.english: And the troops were overtaken by causeless panic and haste.
sentences.chinese: 毫无缘由的匆忙和惊慌支配着军队。

sentences.english: Thickness of welding residual stress is an important reason.

sentences.english: His hermeneutic apparently the shortage to explain the reason that affair occurrence.

sentences.english: Nietzsche’s love for Wagner had a similar beginning, and a similar end to his love of God.
sentences.chinese: 尼采对瓦格纳之爱的始末缘由，与其对上帝之爱相似。

definition: variant of 緣由|缘由[yuan2 you2]
the whys and the wherefores/the detailed story/root cause
cause and effects (idiom); entire process of development
sth one wishes to keep secret/ulterior motive/a subject best avoided
